roleset.name: assert
roleset.note: CLAIM-V NOTES: Frames file for 'claim' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet class claim 37.7, other framed members include declare(?). Comparison with assert. (from claim.01-v predicate notes)
CLAIM-N NOTES: Based on verb entry claim.01; corresponds to Verbnet class claim 37.7-1. (from claim.01-n)

example.name: arg1 as infinitive
example.text: That represents a very thin ``excess'' return, certainly far less than what most fundamental stock pickers claim *trace* to seek as their performance objective.
example.arg: *trace* to seek as their performance objective

example.name: arg1 as full sentence
example.text: Some even claim the group has become a lagging, not leading, indicator.
example.arg: the group has become a lagging, not leading, indicator

example.name: arg1 as NP
example.text: A shareholders' accord would provide the first restitution to thousands of individuals and institutions claiming losses as a result of insider trading by Boesky& Co., once the largest arbitrage fund in the U.S..
example.arg: losses as a result of insider trading by Boesky& Co., once the largest arbitrage fund in the U.S.

example.name: passive extraction
example.text: DD Acquisition has launched a suit in a Delaware court seeking the withdrawal of Dunkin's poison pill rights and employee stock ownership plans, which it claims *trace* were put in place to deter bidders.
example.arg: which -> Dunkin's poison pill rights and employee stock ownership plans
*trace* were put in place to deter bidders

example.name: with hearer
example.text: As he left, the man apologized and claimed to her that his gun wasn't a real firearm, just an unloaded BB gun.
example.arg: that his gun wasn't a real firearm, just an uloaded BB gun.

example.name: Within LVC
example.text: The U.S. attorney 's office , in documents it filed in response , said Mrs. Marcos was making the `` fanciful -- and factually unsupported -- claim that she was kidnapped into this country '' in order to obtain classified material in the case .
example.arg: that she was kidnapped into this country ''
in order to obtain classified material in the case .

example.name: All arguments
example.text: The suspect did not leave the country contrary to her claim to Pilapil that she was in Australia prior to the incident.
example.arg: that she was in Australia prior to the incident.

roleset.name: seize
roleset.note: CLAIM-V NOTES: Frames file for 'claim' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet class claim 37.7, other framed members include declare(?). Comparison with assert. (from claim.02-v predicate notes)
CLAIM-N NOTES: Based on verb entry claim.02; No corresponding VN Class. (from claim.02-n)

example.name: all args
example.text: Cortez claimed the new territory for Queen Anna

example.name: With CAU
example.text: I certainly encourage people to claim in the event [0]-2 [the cover]-1 could not be CLAIMED on *-1 [*T*-2], or if they were not told about it and it was not mentioned in their documents -LRB- sometimes it s sold as an after agreement cover , ie when you activate the card , they sell it to you then as a separate thing , but some people were just told they had to have it , which was wrong -RRB- , but I do nt like this idea of people basically trying to steal money from the lender by making false claims .

example.name: A more straight-forward example of arg1 and CAU in a similar usage
example.text: My question is , does the above give us sufficient reason [0]-1 *PRO* to make a complain to Nationwide and potentially claim for the following [*T*-1]:

example.name: Idiomatic
example.text: Her claim to fame is that she can recite the entire works of Shakespeare.

example.name: With benefactive
example.text: This form provides a claim of tax credit for nonresident military spouses.
